items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135.
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135.

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
	 
Minimum Wage Increase
Student Salary Schedule & Level Requirements effective 01/01/15
Short-Term Hourly Salary Schedule effective 01/01/15
	 
Professional Expert Job Description
Tobacco Cessation & Education Coach effective 12/01/14

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions exceeding the current bid limit of $84,100 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts, although not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions for the period of October 10, 2014 through November 9, 2014 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
Proposition 39 is the California Clean Energy Jobs Act which allocates revenue to the Clean Energy Job Creation Fund for five fiscal years, beginning with fiscal year 2013-14.  Eligible Districts can request funding by submitting an energy expenditure plan application to the California Energy Commission.  The Energy Commission approves plans and works with the California Department of Education which distributes funds after plans have been approved.  
	 
AlfaTech was awarded a Master Agreement by the Board of Trustees on May 25, 2012. 
	 
The scope of this PAA EVC - 01 is to provide complete design, construction administration and closeout services for Prop 39 Year 2 Projects for SJECCD.  This will include lighting retrofit and replacement projects at EVC buildings Gullo 1, 2 and the Gym; and the SJCC Library/Learning Resource Center building.  In addition, the PAA includes the design of lighting upgrades to parking/roadway lighting on the SJCC Campus.  The design fee of $92,479 includes an allowance of $5,000 for value engineering or bid alternate design services.  The use of this allowance will require prior written approval from the District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) Evergreen Valley College Prop 39 Year 2 in the amount of $92,479 to AlfaTech, for the Prop39 Year 2 Project - Project #25103 at Evergreen Valley College (EVC) and San Jose City College (SJCC.)
items.item_text: Evergreen Valley College, San Jose City College and Prop 39 Year 2 Project #25103 – AlphaTech Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC - 01 Prop 39 Year 2
items.item_text_raw: 10. Evergreen Valley College, San Jose City College and Prop 39 Year 2 Project #25103 – AlphaTech Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC - 01 Prop 39 Year 2

items.item_details:
On October 10, 2012, SJECCD entered into an Agreement with HMC Architects to create District Standards and Campus Design Guidelines.  The creation of such standards and guidelines is common in large institutional settings with ongoing capital improvements. Gilbane, along with District representatives, has followed the shared governance process to prepare and review the various components in need of standardization to the appropriate staff, committees, councils and constituent groups from both colleges.  
	 
On March 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees adopted a list of proprietary (sole source) materials and products that were identified during the standards review process and determined to be essential, so that substitute products would not be allowed.  These proprietary materials and products are included within the District Design Standards and Campus Design Guidelines, along with many components, systems and products that are not proprietary and for which the District welcomes equal or better alternatives.   
	 
With the completion of this process, the District Standards and Campus Design Guidelines document is available for the future planning of projects on both campuses.   The full 1,056 page document is attached for reference. 
  
District staff and Gilbane are developing a process by which this document may be amended and expanded in the future.  All new or revised components of this District Standards and Campus Design Guidelines document will be presented to the appropriate staff, committees, councils and constituent groups from both colleges, similar to this initial process.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the SJECCD District Design Standards and Campus Design Guidelines, dated June 2014, as prepared by HMC Architects in collaboration with Gilbane and District staff.
items.item_text: District Standards and Campus Design Guidelines
items.item_text_raw: 11. District Standards and Campus Design Guidelines

items.item_details:
On December 10,2013 the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Galeb Paving, Inc. in the amount of $756,000 to provide construction services for the Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project at the Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District requested design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 005 is a credit to the District for  retaining wall construction that was not needed.
	 
Galeb Paving, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the Agenda attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                    $756,000
Previously Approved Changes              $74,418
Deductive Change Order No. 005        ($2,500)
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $827,918
	 
The net change to Galeb Paving, Inc. contract as a result of all changes issued is $71,918 which equates to 9.51% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Deductive Change Order No. 005 in the amount of ($2,500) to Galeb Paving Inc., for the Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project #32313 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project #32313 – Galeb Paving, Inc. Deductive Change Order No. 005

On May 14, 2013 the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Swenson and Associates in the amount of $9,965,000 to provide construction services for Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project #32306 at the Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District requested design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Deductive Change Order No. 013 is for a credit to the District for the unused portion of allowances.  
                       
Swenson and Associates submitted written pricing proposals for these changes that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
                       
Original Contract Amount                    $9,965,000
Previously Approved Changes               $392,730
Deductive Change Order No. 013           ($42,966)
	 
Revised Contract Amount                   $10,314,764
	 
The net change to Swenson and Associates contract as a result of all changes issued is $349,764 which equates to 3.51% of the original contract.  This deductive change will be refunded to project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Deductive Change Order No. 013 in the amount of ($42,966) to Swenson and Associates, for the Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project #32306 at Evergreen Valley College.

On August 26, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a lease-leaseback contract with Blach Construction Company in the amount of $41,639,729 to provide construction services for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District request design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 003 includes increasing the size of the building’s electrical inverters, adding security cameras to the Fitness Center building, and extending the underground conduits into the building for future telecommunication systems.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.  
	 
Original Contract Amount                             $41,639,729
Previously Approved Changes                     $    (429,272)
Change Order No. 003                                 $       83,456
Revised Contract Amount                            $41,293,913
	 
The net change to Blach Construction Company’s contract as a result of all changes issued is ($345,816), which equates to (0.83%) of the original contract.  This change order will be funded by the project construction cost established in the project budget.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 003 in the amount of $83,456 to Blach Construction Company for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details:
The contract for the Water Service Replacement Project #32311 at Evergreen Valley College, was necessary to complete the installation, remediation, and replacement measures of the Campus wide water infrastructures at the Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
On April 5, 2014, the Board approved the Agreement for S&H Construction to perform the Work.  On May 15, 2014, construction activity began and on September 22, 2014, major construction activity was completed.  As of September 22, 2014, all construction work has been approved by the Architect of Record, all closeout documents have been received, Change Orders have been approved and all contracts have been closed.  
	 
Once approved, this Notice of Completion (NOC) will be filed with the County of Santa Clara, Office of the Recorder.

items.item_details:
The contract for the EVC & SJCC LED Parking Lot Lighting Fixture Replacement Project #0327-14, was necessary to replace the existing pole mounted metal halide parking lot lights at both Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College with high efficiency LED light fixtures.
	 
On April 9, 2014, the Board approved the Agreement for Intermountain Electric Company to perform the work.  On April 9, 2014, construction activity began, and on June 30, 2014, major construction activity was completed.  As of June 30, 2014, all construction work has been approved by the Architect of Record, all closeout documents have been received, Change Orders have been approved and all contracts have been closed.  Minor punchlist work was completed by July 31, 2014.  
	 
Once approved, this NOC will be filed with the County of Santa Clara, Office of the Recorder.

items.item_details:
The contract for the Campus Site Improvements Project #31116-01 Site Fencing at San Jose City College was necessary to install new site fencing and pedestrian/vehicular gates. The newly installed fence along the perimeter of the campus increased campus safety and assisted in deterring crime. The new pedestrian gate replaced the broken turnstile gate in order to provide ADA access to stadium events at San Jose City College. The new vehicular gates maintained security during off-hours and regulated unwanted traffic flow from residential neighborhood streets.
	 
On August 13, 2013 the Board approved the Agreement with Crusader Fence Co. Inc. to perform the Work.  On September 9, 2014 construction activity began and on October 15, 2014 major construction activity was completed. As of October 15, 2014 all closeout documents have been received, Change Orders have been approved and all contracts have been closed.  
	 
Once approved, this Notice of Completion (NOC) will be filed with the County of Santa Clara, Office of the Recorder.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Notice of Completion (NOC) for the contract with Crusader Fence Co. Inc, for the Campus Site Improvements Project #31116-01- Site Fencing at San Jose City College.

items.item_details:
The San Jose Evergreen Community College District (SJECCD), on behalf of the SJECCD Board of Trustees, conducted a Request for Qualification, Request for Proposal, and consultant interview process to identify consultants that will assist the District with the selection, procurement, installation, and move coordination of Furniture, Fixtures and Equipment (FF&E).  Proposals were received from five firms, and through the selection process, two were selected to provide FF&E consulting services to the District.  Services provided by the qualified consulting firms will be required to complete various new and renovation building projects over the next three to five years.  The District will rely on the consultant to provide a standard of care equal to the best practice in the industry at the time of service.  Establishing a pool of pre-qualified consultants for FF&E coordination enhances the District’s efforts related to Design Standards and provides consistency across projects at both campuses as it relates to FF&E procurement and installation.
	 
The Consultant will coordinate and plan the development of equipment specifications, infrastructure requirements, furniture layouts, budget and cost estimates, procurement strategies and specifications, and delivery schedules.  The consultant will review project submittals, coordinate installation and inspection, and assist with competitive bidding, project start-up/closeout and relocation management.  In addition, the Consultant will familiarize itself with  the  District FF&E standards and will assist with further development of and updating of the District-Wide and College specific FF&E standards in consultation with District Business Services, College User Groups, Information Technology Services, Maintenance & Operations staff, Project Team, Architects, and other District appointed consultants, students, and employees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Standard Form of Master Agreement to KRJ Design Group, Inc. for the SJECCD District-Wide FF&E Consultant Services at both Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City Colleges.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District (SJECCD) District-Wide Furniture – KRJ Design Group, Inc. Fixtures & Equipment (FF&E) Consultant Services Master Agreement
items.item_text_raw: 11. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District (SJECCD) District-Wide Furniture – KRJ Design Group, Inc. Fixtures & Equipment (FF&E) Consultant Services Master Agreement

The Consultant will coordinate and plan the development of equipment specifications, infrastructure requirements, furniture layouts, budget and cost estimates, procurement strategies and specifications, and delivery schedules.  The consultant will review project submittals, coordinate installation and inspection, and assist with competitive bidding, project start-up/closeout and relocation management.  In addition, the Consultant will familiarize itself with  the  District FF&E standards and will assist with further development of and updating of the District-Wide and College specific FF&E standards in consultation with District Business Services, College User Groups, Information Technology Services, Maintenance & Operations staff, Project Team, Architects, and other District appointed consultants, students, and employees.

items.item_details: This quote is for Dasher Technologies to provide labor for moving network servers from the current Data Center to the new Data Center at 40 S. Market St. The work includes de-racking servers, prepping them for transportation, transporting them, preparing for installation, racking servers according to layouts and labels, and cabling the equipment to the new network. This work is based on the IT Integrator RFP #G2010.0099 and the selection of Dasher Technologies.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an ICA for Dasher Technologies to relocate IT servers from the current Data Center to the new Data Center at 40 S. Market Street for a total cost of $18,750.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Data Center Migration Service to 40 S. Market Street
items.item_text_raw: 13. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Data Center Migration Service to 40 S. Market Street

items.item_details: In order to complete the SJCC network discovery for the Network Infrastructure Project (#39705), Dasher Technologies will provide a representative sampling of fiber optics cable testing for the fiber that connects 15 buildings on SJCC campus and 34 Intermediate Distribution Frames (IDF). Dasher will test two unused  fiber strands that connect each building to the campus Main Distribution Frame (MDF) and two unused fibers to each of the 34 IDFs. Dasher will document the type, length, connectors, location, and attenuation of existing fiber optic cabling. This work is based on the IT Integrator RFP #G2010.0099 and the selection of Dasher Technologies.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an ICA for Dasher Technologies to provide fiber backbone testing and documentation at San Jose City College for a total cost of $6,000.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program - Fiber Optics Cable Testing at San Jose City College
items.item_text_raw: 14. Measure G-2010 Bond Program - Fiber Optics Cable Testing at San Jose City College

items.item_details: In order to complete the IT network discovery effort at EVC, for the Network Infrastructure Project (#39705), Dasher Technologies will provide a representative sampling of fiber optics cable testing for the fiber that connects 20 buildings on EVC campus and 33 Intermediate Distribution Frames (IDF). Dasher will test two unused  fiber strands that connect each building to the campus Main Distribution Frame (MDF), and two unused fibers to each of the 34 IDFs. Dasher will document the type, length, connectors, location, and attenuation of existing fiber optic cabling.This work is based on the IT Integrator RFP #G2010.0099 and the selection of Dasher Technologies as IT Integrator.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an ICA for Dasher Technologies to provide fiber backbone testing and documentation at Evergreen Valley College for a total cost of $7,075.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program - Fiber Optics Cable Testing at Evergreen Valley College
items.item_text_raw: 15. Measure G-2010 Bond Program - Fiber Optics Cable Testing at Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 9, 2014.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.

items.item_details:
Proposition 39, which governs the District’s general obligation bonds, requires the establishment of a citizens’ oversight committee.  Following the passage of Measure G-2004 on November 2, 2004, the Board of Trustees took action on May 10, 2005 to establish a Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee. Measure G-2010 was passed by the voters on November 2, 2010, after which the Board of Trustees took action on December 14, 2010 to amend and restate the bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
	 
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) is required by statute to meet at least annually to review the District’s Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 bond projects plan and to ensure that bond funds are being appropriately used as authorized by the voters.  There are no penalties defined in law for failure to convene a citizens’ oversight committee; however, the spirit of the law contemplates that districts will make every reasonable effort to ensure that the committee functions at least once each year to fulfill its statutory duties.  The current CBOC convenes quarterly for meetings.
	 
Pursuant to Proposition 39, the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee is required to have a minimum of seven (7) members comprised of one (1) student active in a community college support group, such as student government, two (2) Community-At-Large members, one (1) Senior Citizens’ Organization member, one (1) Business Community member, one (1) Taxpayer's Association member, and one (1) Support Organization member.  It is requested that the following applicants be appointed or reappointed for an additional term or in a different capacity to the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee by the Board of Trustees to fill current vacancies. 
	 
Renewing Members                 Representing                           Term
Carol Lizak                                Community-At-Large                    3
Jimmy Nguyen                          Taxpayer’s Association                3 
Daniel Kojiro                              Community-At-Large                   3
Johnny Lee                                Business Community Member    1 - Changing Designation from Community-At-Large
                                                                                                
                                                                                                           
New Member                            Representing
Rose Regalado                         Senior Citizens’ Organization       1
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees appoint the following Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee applicants to fill the current vacancy on the committee.

items.item_details:
Background
	 
On February 12, 2013, the San José-Evergreen Community College District Board of Trustees scheduled a “Study Session” and embarked on a transformational journey that concluded on May 13, 2014, with the approval of a revised governance model under the heading   “San José-Evergreen Community College District, Board of Trustees Ends Policies and Governance Principles.”
	 
	 
http://www.sjeccd.edu/Chancellor/Documents/SJECCD%20Board_Ends%20Policies_Governance%20Principles%205%2013%2014.pdf
	 
	 
On October 14, 2014, the Chancellor presented a Workplan describing the "means strategies" to be undertaken by staff, including proposed metrics identified to monitor the implementation of  the "Boards Global Ends Policies."   On November 25, and information/first-reading item was presented to the Board including draft documents for review in advance of their formal approval.  This action item represents the final step in the implementation of the Board of Trustees Ends Policies and Governance Principles; namely; the establishment of the 2015 proposed Calendar of Meetings and the Board's 2015 Agenda.  This approval  formalizes the following actions: 
	 
1.  Transitioning the Board's business process from a Fiscal Year (July to June) to a Calendar Year  (January to December).  
2.  Approval of a new meeting calendar from January 2015 to December 2015.
3.  Adoption of a list of proposed agenda items that include:
a) Regular Cyclical Reports (These are reporting requirements that comply with Ed. Code, Title 5, Board Policies etc.)
b) Ends Policies Accountability Reports (Quarterly reporting on selected Ends Policies (one or two per report)
c) Board Study Sessions (Established and newly requested sessions 2-hrs. or more)
	 
In addition, this item includes background information detailing the measures and metrics to be used in the Monitoring Reports.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the CY2015 Schedule of Governing Board Meeting Dates and Corresponding Deadlines and the CY2015 Board Calendar.
items.item_text: Schedule of Governing Board Meeting Dates and Corresponding Deadlines CY2015, CY2015 Board Calendar, and Monitoring Reports
items.item_text_raw: 3. Schedule of Governing Board Meeting Dates and Corresponding Deadlines CY2015, CY2015 Board Calendar, and Monitoring Reports

items.item_details: A recommendation the Board of Trustees consider the approval of a non-binding letter of intent from Republic Urban Properties, LLC pertaining to the ground lease of the 27.1 acres of surplus land adjoining the Evergreen College campus.  The non-binding letter of intent proposes that the developer pay rent to the District for the lease of the surplus land and the developer would construct various improvements on the land.  Acceptance of the non-binding letter of intent will not commit the District to the development of the surplus land.  After acceptance, the District would then proceed with a bid process required by the Education Code for the solicitation of bids for the development of the surplus land.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation the Board of Trustees consider the approval of a non-binding letter of intent from Republic Urban Properties, LLC pertaining to the ground lease of the 27.1 acres of surplus land adjoining the Evergreen College campus.

items.item_details:
In 2011, the Board approved a consulting agreement with Catalyst Consulting Group, Inc.(Catalyst) to evaluate needs and facilitate a planning process with the college campuses to develop a Security Master Plan for the entire District.   This process included meetings with District Police, the Police Chief, faculty and staff at EVC and SJCC.  As a result of this effort, Catalyst presented a draft Security Master Plan to the District in June 2012, which was then presented and reviewed through the shared governance process at both colleges.
	 
In June 2013, the Board approved Master Agreements with two security consultant firms, Catalyst and Guidepost Solutions (Guidepost), to develop, review and assist in the implementation of specific projects that would advance the initiatives in the Security Master Plan.   Guidepost was assigned Project Assignment Amendments #EVC-02 to perform a full peer review of the Security Master Plan prepared by Catalyst.  Guidepost has completed its peer review and, in collaboration with Catalyst, prepared an informational presentation regarding the Security Master Plan.  This summary level presentation is attached.
items.item_text: SJECCD Security Master Plan - Summary Presentation
items.item_text_raw: 2. SJECCD Security Master Plan - Summary Presentation
